import { useState } from 'react' import emailjs from 'emailjs-com' const initialState = { name: '', lastname: '', email: '', cellphone: '', company: '', position: '', requirement: '', channel: '', message: '' } export const Contact = (props) => { const [{ name, lastname, email, cellphone, company, position, requirement, channel, message }, setState] = useState(initialState) const handleChange = (e) => { const { name, value } = e.target setState((prevState) => ({ ...prevState, [name]: value })) } const clearState = () => setState({ ...initialState }) const handleSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault() console.log(name, lastname, email, cellphone, company, position, requirement, channel, message) emailjs .sendForm( 'gmail', 'gmail_template', e.target, 'user_zdWYM85ci04bpRK6IFnrF' ) .then( (result) => { console.log(result.text) clearState() }, (error) => { console.log(error.text) } ) } const [background, setbackground] = useState("#fdfdfd") const setStyle = background => { setBackground(background); }; return (
